# AI Product Newsletter - Project Architecture & TODO

## üèóÔ∏è Architecture Overview

### Tech Stack Decision
- **Database**: Neon PostgreSQL (serverless, generous free tier)
- **ORM/Schema**: ZenStack (type-safe Prisma wrapper with auto-generated APIs)
- **Frontend**: Vite + React (modern, fast bundling)
- **Backend**: Cloudflare Workers (edge computing, cron jobs)
- **Deployment**: Cloudflare Pages (frontend) + Workers (backend)

### System Architecture
```
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ  Vite + React   ‚îÇ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñ∂‚îÇ Cloudflare Workers‚îÇ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñ∂‚îÇ Neon PostgreSQL ‚îÇ
‚îÇ  Landing Page   ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ API + Cron Jobs   ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ   + ZenStack    ‚îÇ
‚îÇ (CF Pages)      ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ                   ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ                 ‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
```

## üìã Implementation Roadmap

### Phase 1: Database Foundation
- [ ] **Neon Setup**
  - [ ] Create Neon project at https://neon.tech
  - [ ] Get database connection string
  - [ ] Set up connection pooling for Workers
  
- [ ] **ZenStack Integration**
  - [ ] Install ZenStack and dependencies (`bun add zenstack @zenstackhq/runtime`)
  - [ ] Create `schema.zmodel` with subscriber/newsletter models
  - [ ] Generate Prisma client and API handlers
  - [ ] Set up database migrations

### Phase 2: Frontend Development
- [ ] **Vite React Setup**
  - [ ] Create `frontend/` directory
  - [ ] Initialize Vite project (`bun create vite frontend --template react-ts`)
  - [ ] Install dependencies (React, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS)
  
- [ ] **Landing Page Components**
  - [ ] Newsletter subscription form
  - [ ] Email validation and UX feedback
  - [ ] Responsive design with Tailwind
  - [ ] Success/error message handling
  
- [ ] **API Integration**
  - [ ] Create API client for Workers endpoints
  - [ ] Handle form submissions
  - [ ] Add loading states and error handling

### Phase 3: Backend Infrastructure
- [ ] **Cloudflare Workers Setup**
  - [ ] Create `workers/` directory structure
  - [ ] Initialize Workers project with Wrangler
  - [ ] Configure `wrangler.toml` with bindings
  
- [ ] **API Endpoints**
  - [ ] POST /api/subscribe (newsletter subscription)
  - [ ] GET /api/health (system health check)
  - [ ] POST /api/unsubscribe (unsubscribe handling)
  
- [ ] **Cron Job Implementation**
  - [ ] Weekly newsletter generation worker
  - [ ] AI content aggregation from sources
  - [ ] Email sending integration (Resend/SendGrid)
  - [ ] Cleanup and maintenance tasks

### Phase 4: Data Models & Schema

#### ZenStack Schema (`schema.zmodel`)
```prisma
// Subscribers table
model Subscriber {
  id          Int      @id @default(autoincrement())
  email       String   @unique
  status      Status   @default(ACTIVE)
  preferences Json?    // Topics, frequency
  createdAt   DateTime @default(now())
  updatedAt   DateTime @updatedAt
  
  @@allow('create', true)
  @@allow('read', true)
  @@allow('update', true)
}

// Newsletter issues
model Newsletter {
  id           Int      @id @default(autoincrement())
  title        String
  content      String   // HTML content
  summary      String?  // Brief summary
  status       NewsletterStatus @default(DRAFT)
  scheduledAt  DateTime?
  sentAt       DateTime?
  createdAt    DateTime @default(now())
  
  analytics    NewsletterAnalytics[]
  
  @@allow('create', true)
  @@allow('read', true)
  @@allow('update', true)
}

// Analytics tracking
model NewsletterAnalytics {
  id           Int      @id @default(autoincrement())
  newsletterId Int
  newsletter   Newsletter @relation(fields: [newsletterId], references: [id])
  metricType   MetricType
  count        Int      @default(0)
  recordedAt   DateTime @default(now())
  
  @@allow('create', true)
  @@allow('read', true)
}

enum Status {
  ACTIVE
  PAUSED  
  UNSUBSCRIBED
}

enum NewsletterStatus {
  DRAFT
  SCHEDULED
  SENT
}

enum MetricType {
  SENT
  OPENED
  CLICKED
  UNSUBSCRIBED
}
```

### Phase 5: Deployment & Configuration
- [ ] **Environment Variables**
  - [ ] `DATABASE_URL` (Neon connection string)
  - [ ] `DATABASE_DIRECT_URL` (for migrations)
  - [ ] `RESEND_API_KEY` or `SENDGRID_API_KEY`
  - [ ] `OPENAI_API_KEY` (for content generation)
  
- [ ] **Cloudflare Configuration**
  - [ ] Set up Pages deployment from `frontend/`
  - [ ] Configure Workers with database bindings
  - [ ] Set up custom domain (optional)
  
- [ ] **CI/CD Pipeline**
  - [ ] GitHub Actions for automated deployment
  - [ ] Database migration workflow
  - [ ] Environment-specific configurations

## üîß Development Workflow

### Local Development Setup
```bash
# 1. Clone and install dependencies
bun install

# 2. Set up environment variables
cp .env.example .env.local

# 3. Database setup
bunx zenstack generate
bunx prisma db push

# 4. Start frontend development
cd frontend && bun run dev

# 5. Start Workers development (separate terminal)
cd workers && bun run dev
```

### Project Structure
```
ai-product-newsletter/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ TODOS.md
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ package.json
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ schema.zmodel          # ZenStack schema
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ .env.local            # Environment variables
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ frontend/             # Vite + React app
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ src/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ public/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ package.json
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ vite.config.ts
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ workers/              # Cloudflare Workers
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ api/              # API endpoints
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ cron/             # Scheduled jobs
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ wrangler.toml
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ package.json
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ shared/               # Common types and utilities
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ types.ts
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ utils.ts
```

## üöÄ MVP Features (Phase 1)
1. **Landing page** with email subscription form
2. **Database** storing subscriber emails
3. **Basic API** for subscription management
4. **Simple cron job** for weekly newsletter generation
5. **Email delivery** integration

## üîÆ Future Enhancements (Phase 2+)
- Admin dashboard for newsletter management
- Advanced subscriber segmentation
- A/B testing for subject lines
- Newsletter template customization
- Analytics and reporting dashboard
- Social media integration
- AI-powered content personalization

## üìä Success Metrics
- [ ] Successful email subscription flow
- [ ] Automated newsletter generation working
- [ ] Email delivery working correctly
- [ ] Database operations performing well
- [ ] Frontend deployed and accessible
- [ ] Cron jobs executing on schedule

---

model Subscriber {
  id          Int      @id @default(autoincrement())
  email       String   @unique
  status      Status   @default(ACTIVE)
  preferences Json?    // Topics, frequency
  createdAt   DateTime @default(now())
  updatedAt   DateTime @updatedAt
  
  @@allow('create', true)
  @@allow('read', true)
  @@allow('update', true)
}

// Newsletter issues
model Newsletter {
  id           Int      @id @default(autoincrement())
  title        String
  content      String   // HTML content
  summary      String?  // Brief summary
  status       NewsletterStatus @default(DRAFT)
  scheduledAt  DateTime?
  sentAt       DateTime?
  createdAt    DateTime @default(now())
  
  analytics    NewsletterAnalytics[]
  
  @@allow('create', true)
  @@allow('read', true)
  @@allow('update', true)
}

// Analytics tracking
model NewsletterAnalytics {
  id           Int      @id @default(autoincrement())
  newsletterId Int
  newsletter   Newsletter @relation(fields: [newsletterId], references: [id])
  metricType   MetricType
  count        Int      @default(0)
  recordedAt   DateTime @default(now())
  
  @@allow('create', true)
  @@allow('read', true)
}

enum Status {
  ACTIVE
  PAUSED  
  UNSUBSCRIBED
}

enum NewsletterStatus {
  DRAFT
  SCHEDULED
  SENT
}

enum MetricType {
  SENT
  OPENED
  CLICKED
  UNSUBSCRIBED
}
```

### Phase 5: Deployment & Configuration
- [ ] **Environment Variables**
  - [ ] `DATABASE_URL` (Neon connection string)
  - [ ] `DATABASE_DIRECT_URL` (for migrations)
  - [ ] `RESEND_API_KEY` or `SENDGRID_API_KEY`
  - [ ] `OPENAI_API_KEY` (for content generation)
  
- [ ] **Cloudflare Configuration**
  - [ ] Set up Pages deployment from `frontend/`
  - [ ] Configure Workers with database bindings
  - [ ] Set up custom domain (optional)
  
- [ ] **CI/CD Pipeline**
  - [ ] GitHub Actions for automated deployment
  - [ ] Database migration workflow
  - [ ] Environment-specific configurations

## üîß Development Workflow

### Local Development Setup
```bash
# 1. Clone and install dependencies
bun install

# 2. Set up environment variables
cp .env.example .env.local

# 3. Database setup
bunx zenstack generate
bunx prisma db push

# 4. Start frontend development
cd frontend && bun run dev

# 5. Start Workers development (separate terminal)
cd workers && bun run dev
```

```

# AI Product Newsletter - Project Architecture & TODO

## üèóÔ∏è Architecture Overview

### Tech Stack Decision
- **Database**: Neon PostgreSQL (serverless, generous free tier)
- **ORM/Schema**: ZenStack (type-safe Prisma wrapper with auto-generated APIs)
- **Frontend**: Vite + React (modern, fast bundling)
- **Backend**: Cloudflare Workers (edge computing, cron jobs)
- **Deployment**: Cloudflare Pages (frontend) + Workers (backend)

### System Architecture
```
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ  Vite + React   ‚îÇ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñ∂‚îÇ Cloudflare Workers‚îÇ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñ∂‚îÇ Neon PostgreSQL ‚îÇ
‚îÇ  Landing Page   ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ API + Cron Jobs   ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ   + ZenStack    ‚îÇ
‚îÇ (CF Pages)      ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ                   ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ                 ‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
```

## üìã Implementation Roadmap

### Phase 1: Database Foundation ‚úÖ COMPLETED
- [x] **Neon Setup**
  - [x] Create Neon project at https://neon.tech (Project ID: `damp-term-76460827`)
  - [x] Get database connection string
  - [x] Set up connection pooling for Workers
  
- [x] **ZenStack Integration**
  - [x] Install ZenStack and dependencies (`bun add zenstack @zenstackhq/runtime`)
  - [x] Create `schema.zmodel` with subscriber/newsletter models
  - [x] Generate Prisma client and API handlers
  - [x] Set up database migrations

### Phase 2: Frontend Development
- [ ] **Vite React Setup**
  - [ ] Create `frontend/` directory
  - [ ] Initialize Vite project (`bun create vite frontend --template react-ts`)
  - [ ] Install dependencies (React, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS)
  
- [ ] **Landing Page Components**
  - [ ] Newsletter subscription form
  - [ ] Email validation and UX feedback
  - [ ] Responsive design with Tailwind
  - [ ] Success/error message handling
  
- [ ] **API Integration**
  - [ ] Create API client for Workers endpoints
  - [ ] Handle form submissions
  - [ ] Add loading states and error handling

### Phase 3: Backend Infrastructure
- [ ] **Cloudflare Workers Setup**
  - [ ] Create `workers/` directory structure
  - [ ] Initialize Workers project with Wrangler
  - [ ] Configure `wrangler.toml` with bindings
  
- [ ] **API Endpoints**
  - [ ] POST /api/subscribe (newsletter subscription)
  - [ ] GET /api/health (system health check)
  - [ ] POST /api/unsubscribe (unsubscribe handling)
  
- [ ] **Cron Job Implementation**
  - [ ] Weekly newsletter generation worker
  - [ ] AI content aggregation from sources
  - [ ] Email sending integration (Resend/SendGrid)
  - [ ] Cleanup and maintenance tasks

### Phase 4: Data Models & Schema

#### ZenStack Schema (`schema.zmodel`)
```prisma
// Subscribers table
model Subscriber {
  id          Int      @id @default(autoincrement())
  email       String   @unique
  status      Status   @default(ACTIVE)
  preferences Json?    // Topics, frequency
  createdAt   DateTime @default(now())
  updatedAt   DateTime @updatedAt
  
  @@allow('create', true)
  @@allow('read', true)
  @@allow('update', true)
}

// Newsletter issues
model Newsletter {
  id           Int      @id @default(autoincrement())
  title        String
  content      String   // HTML content
  summary      String?  // Brief summary
  status       NewsletterStatus @default(DRAFT)
  scheduledAt  DateTime?
  sentAt       DateTime?
  createdAt    DateTime @default(now())
  
  analytics    NewsletterAnalytics[]
  
  @@allow('create', true)
  @@allow('read', true)
  @@allow('update', true)
}

// Analytics tracking
model NewsletterAnalytics {
  id           Int      @id @default(autoincrement())
  newsletterId Int
  newsletter   Newsletter @relation(fields: [newsletterId], references: [id])
  metricType   MetricType
  count        Int      @default(0)
  recordedAt   DateTime @default(now())
  
  @@allow('create', true)
  @@allow('read', true)
}

enum Status {
  ACTIVE
  PAUSED  
  UNSUBSCRIBED
}

enum NewsletterStatus {
  DRAFT
  SCHEDULED
  SENT
}

enum MetricType {
  SENT
  OPENED
  CLICKED
  UNSUBSCRIBED
}
```

### Phase 5: Deployment & Configuration
- [ ] **Environment Variables**
  - [ ] `DATABASE_URL` (Neon connection string)
  - [ ] `DATABASE_DIRECT_URL` (for migrations)
  - [ ] `RESEND_API_KEY` or `SENDGRID_API_KEY`
  - [ ] `OPENAI_API_KEY` (for content generation)
  
- [ ] **Cloudflare Configuration**
  - [ ] Set up Pages deployment from `frontend/`
  - [ ] Configure Workers with database bindings
  - [ ] Set up custom domain (optional)
  
- [ ] **CI/CD Pipeline**
  - [ ] GitHub Actions for automated deployment
  - [ ] Database migration workflow
  - [ ] Environment-specific configurations

## üîß Development Workflow

### Local Development Setup
```bash
# 1. Clone and install dependencies
bun install

# 2. Set up environment variables
cp .env.example .env.local

# 3. Database setup
bunx zenstack generate
bunx prisma db push

# 4. Start frontend development
cd frontend && bun run dev

# 5. Start Workers development (separate terminal)
cd workers && bun run dev
```

### Project Structure
```
ai-product-newsletter/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ TODOS.md
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ package.json
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ schema.zmodel          # ZenStack schema

‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ src/

‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ package.json
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ vite.config.ts
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ workers/              # Cloudflare Workers
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ api/              # API endpoints
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ cron/             # Scheduled jobs
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ wrangler.toml
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ package.json
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ shared/               # Common types and utilities
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ types.ts
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ utils.ts
```

## üöÄ MVP Features (Phase 1)
1. **Landing page** with email subscription form
2. **Database** storing subscriber emails
3. **Basic API** for subscription management
4. **Simple cron job** for weekly newsletter generation
5. **Email delivery** integration

## üîÆ Future Enhancements (Phase 2+)
- Admin dashboard for newsletter management
- Advanced subscriber segmentation
- A/B testing for subject lines
- Newsletter template customization
- Analytics and reporting dashboard
- Social media integration
- AI-powered content personalization

## üìä Success Metrics
- [ ] Successful email subscription flow
- [ ] Automated newsletter generation working
- [ ] Email delivery working correctly
- [ ] Database operations performing well
- [ ] Frontend deployed and accessible
- [ ] Cron jobs executing on schedule

---

# AI Product Newsletter - Project Architecture & TODO

## üèóÔ∏è Architecture Overview

### Tech Stack Decision
- **Database**: Neon PostgreSQL (serverless, generous free tier)
- **ORM/Schema**: ZenStack (type-safe Prisma wrapper with auto-generated APIs)
- **Frontend**: Vite + React (modern, fast bundling)
- **Backend**: Cloudflare Workers (edge computing, cron jobs)
- **Deployment**: Cloudflare Pages (frontend) + Workers (backend)

### System Architecture
```
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ  Vite + React   ‚îÇ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñ∂‚îÇ Cloudflare Workers‚îÇ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñ∂‚îÇ Neon PostgreSQL ‚îÇ
‚îÇ  Landing Page   ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ API + Cron Jobs   ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ   + ZenStack    ‚îÇ
‚îÇ (CF Pages)      ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ                   ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ                 ‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
```

## üìã Implementation Roadmap

### Phase 1: Database Foundation ‚úÖ COMPLETED
- [x] **Neon Setup**
  - [x] Create Neon project at https://neon.tech (Project ID: `damp-term-76460827`)
  - [x] Get database connection string
  - [x] Set up connection pooling for Workers
  
- [x] **ZenStack Integration**
  - [x] Install ZenStack and dependencies (`bun add zenstack @zenstackhq/runtime`)
  - [x] Create `schema.zmodel` with subscriber/newsletter models
  - [x] Generate Prisma client and API handlers
  - [x] Set up database migrations

### Phase 2: Frontend Development ‚úÖ COMPLETED
- [x] **Vite React Setup**
  - [x] Create `frontend/` directory
  - [x] Initialize Vite project (`bun create vite frontend --template react-ts`)
  - [x] Install dependencies (React, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS)
  
- [x] **Landing Page Components**
  - [x] Newsletter subscription form
  - [x] Email validation and UX feedback
  - [x] Responsive design with Tailwind
  - [x] Success/error message handling
  
- [x] **API Integration**
  - [x] Create API client for Workers endpoints
  - [x] Handle form submissions
  - [x] Add loading states and error handling

### Phase 3: Backend Infrastructure
- [ ] **Cloudflare Workers Setup**
  - [ ] Create `workers/` directory structure
  - [ ] Initialize Workers project with Wrangler
  - [ ] Configure `wrangler.toml` with bindings
  
- [ ] **API Endpoints**
  - [ ] POST /api/subscribe (newsletter subscription)
  - [ ] GET /api/health (system health check)
  - [ ] POST /api/unsubscribe (unsubscribe handling)
  
- [ ] **Cron Job Implementation**
  - [ ] Weekly newsletter generation worker
  - [ ] AI content aggregation from sources
  - [ ] Email sending integration (Resend/SendGrid)
  - [ ] Cleanup and maintenance tasks

### Phase 4: Data Models & Schema

#### ZenStack Schema (`schema.zmodel`)
```prisma
// Subscribers table
model Subscriber {
  id          Int      @id @default(autoincrement())
  email       String   @unique
  status      Status   @default(ACTIVE)
  preferences Json?    // Topics, frequency
  createdAt   DateTime @default(now())
  updatedAt   DateTime @updatedAt
  
  @@allow('create', true)
  @@allow('read', true)
  @@allow('update', true)
}

// Newsletter issues
model Newsletter {
  id           Int      @id @default(autoincrement())
  title        String
  content      String   // HTML content
  summary      String?  // Brief summary
  status       NewsletterStatus @default(DRAFT)
  scheduledAt  DateTime?
  sentAt       DateTime?
  createdAt    DateTime @default(now())
  
  analytics    NewsletterAnalytics[]
  
  @@allow('create', true)
  @@allow('read', true)
  @@allow('update', true)
}

// Analytics tracking
model NewsletterAnalytics {
  id           Int      @id @default(autoincrement())
  newsletterId Int
  newsletter   Newsletter @relation(fields: [newsletterId], references: [id])
  metricType   MetricType
  count        Int      @default(0)
  recordedAt   DateTime @default(now())
  
  @@allow('create', true)
  @@allow('read', true)
}

enum Status {
  ACTIVE
  PAUSED  
  UNSUBSCRIBED
}

enum NewsletterStatus {
  DRAFT
  SCHEDULED
  SENT
}

enum MetricType {
  SENT
  OPENED
  CLICKED
  UNSUBSCRIBED
}
```

### Phase 5: Deployment & Configuration
- [ ] **Environment Variables**
  - [ ] `DATABASE_URL` (Neon connection string)
  - [ ] `DATABASE_DIRECT_URL` (for migrations)
  - [ ] `RESEND_API_KEY` or `SENDGRID_API_KEY`
  - [ ] `OPENAI_API_KEY` (for content generation)
  
- [ ] **Cloudflare Configuration**
  - [ ] Set up Pages deployment from `frontend/`
  - [ ] Configure Workers with database bindings
  - [ ] Set up custom domain (optional)
  
- [ ] **CI/CD Pipeline**
  - [ ] GitHub Actions for automated deployment
  - [ ] Database migration workflow
  - [ ] Environment-specific configurations

## üîß Development Workflow

### Local Development Setup
```bash
# 1. Clone and install dependencies
bun install

# 2. Set up environment variables
cp .env.example .env.local

# 3. Database setup
bunx zenstack generate
bunx prisma db push

# 4. Start frontend development
cd frontend && bun run dev

# 5. Start Workers development (separate terminal)
cd workers && bun run dev
```

### Project Structure
```
ai-product-newsletter/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ TODOS.md
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ package.json
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ schema.zmodel          # ZenStack schema
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ .env.local            # Environment variables
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ frontend/             # Vite + React app
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ src/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ public/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ package.json
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ vite.config.ts
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ workers/              # Cloudflare Workers
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ api/              # API endpoints
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ cron/             # Scheduled jobs
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ wrangler.toml
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ package.json
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ shared/               # Common types and utilities
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ types.ts
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ utils.ts
```

## üöÄ MVP Features (Phase 1)
1. **Landing page** with email subscription form
2. **Database** storing subscriber emails
3. **Basic API** for subscription management
4. **Simple cron job** for weekly newsletter generation
5. **Email delivery** integration

## üîÆ Future Enhancements (Phase 2+)
- Admin dashboard for newsletter management
- Advanced subscriber segmentation
- A/B testing for subject lines
- Newsletter template customization
- Analytics and reporting dashboard
- Social media integration
- AI-powered content personalization

## üìä Success Metrics
- [ ] Successful email subscription flow
- [ ] Automated newsletter generation working
- [ ] Email delivery working correctly
- [ ] Database operations performing well
- [ ] Frontend deployed and accessible
- [ ] Cron jobs executing on schedule

---

**Phase 1 Complete!** ‚úÖ Database Foundation is ready with:
- Neon PostgreSQL project created (ID: `damp-term-76460827`) 
- ZenStack schema with Subscriber, Newsletter, and Analytics models
- Database tables created and ready for use
- Environment variables configured

**Next Steps**: Proceed with Phase 2 - Frontend Development or Phase 3 - Backend Infrastructure.

---
description: AI Product Newsletter Frontend - React + TypeScript + Vite + Tailwind
globs: "*.ts, *.tsx, *.html, *.css, *.js, *.jsx, package.json"
alwaysApply: false
---

# AI Product Newsletter Frontend

## Tech Stack
- **React 19** with TypeScript
- **Vite** for development and building
- **Tailwind CSS** with forms plugin for styling
- **Bun** as package manager

## Development

### Commands
```bash
bun install          # Install dependencies
bun run dev          # Start development server (http://localhost:5173)
bun run build        # Build for production
bun run preview      # Preview production build
bun run lint         # Run ESLint
```

### File Structure
```
src/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ App.tsx          # Main application component
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ api.ts           # API client functions
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ index.css        # Tailwind CSS imports
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ main.tsx         # React app entry point
```

## Styling Guidelines
- Use Tailwind CSS classes for all styling
- Follow responsive-first approach with mobile breakpoints
- Use Tailwind's color palette (indigo for primary, gray for neutral)
- Forms use `@tailwindcss/forms` plugin for consistent styling

## API Integration
- All API calls go through `src/api.ts`
- API base URL configurable via `VITE_API_URL` environment variable
- Default API endpoint: `/api` (proxied to backend)
- Handle loading states, errors, and success responses

## Component Guidelines
- Use functional components with hooks
- Implement proper TypeScript types
- Handle loading and error states in UI
- Use controlled components for forms
- Include proper accessibility attributes

## Environment Variables
Create `.env.local` in frontend directory:
```env
VITE_API_URL=http://localhost:8787  # For local Cloudflare Workers
```

## Current Features
- Newsletter subscription form
- Email validation
- Loading states and error handling
- Success/error messaging
- Responsive design

## Future Development
- Form field validation library
- Toast notifications
- Dark mode toggle

# AI Product Newsletter Frontend

## Tech Stack
- **React 19** with TypeScript
- **Vite** for development and building
- **Tailwind CSS** with forms plugin for styling
- **Bun** as package manager

## Development

### Commands
```bash
bun install          # Install dependencies
bun run dev          # Start development server (http://localhost:5173)
bun run build        # Build for production
bun run preview      # Preview production build
bun run lint         # Run ESLint
```

### File Structure
```
src/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ App.tsx          # Main application component
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ api.ts           # API client functions
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ index.css        # Tailwind CSS imports
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ main.tsx         # React app entry point
```

## Styling Guidelines
- Use Tailwind CSS classes for all styling
- Follow responsive-first approach with mobile breakpoints
- Use Tailwind's color palette (indigo for primary, gray for neutral)
- Forms use `@tailwindcss/forms` plugin for consistent styling

## API Integration
- All API calls go through `src/api.ts`
- API base URL configurable via `VITE_API_URL` environment variable
- Default API endpoint: `/api` (proxied to backend)
- Handle loading states, errors, and success responses

## Component Guidelines
- Use functional components with hooks
- Implement proper TypeScript types
- Handle loading and error states in UI
- Use controlled components for forms
- Include proper accessibility attributes

## Environment Variables
Create `.env.local` in frontend directory:
```env
VITE_API_URL=http://localhost:8787  # For local Cloudflare Workers
```

## Current Features
- Newsletter subscription form
- Email validation
- Loading states and error handling
- Success/error messaging
- Responsive design

## Future Development
- Form field validation library
- Toast notifications
- Dark mode toggle
- Newsletter archive page
- Unsubscribe functionality
